african_professional_leadership.name: ·ªåg√° Visionary
african_professional_leadership.short: Sees the path forward with ancestral wisdom
african_professional_leadership.long: This leader combines forward vision with deep wisdom, seeing opportunities others miss while honoring the lessons of those who came before. They chart the course with both innovation and respect for tradition.

african_professional_leadership.name: Ubuntu Builder
african_professional_leadership.short: Lifts the whole community, celebrates collective success
african_professional_leadership.long: Embodies Ubuntu - 'I am because we are.' This person understands that individual success means nothing without community elevation. They create spaces where everyone's gifts contribute to collective flourishing.

african_professional_leadership.name: Council Leader
african_professional_leadership.short: Makes wise decisions with counsel, not alone
african_professional_leadership.long: Knows that the best decisions come from gathering diverse wisdom. They consult elders, peers, and even youth before making important calls, but have the strength to decide when the time comes.

african_professional_leadership.name: Griot of Values
african_professional_leadership.short: Keeps the culture alive through stories and example
african_professional_leadership.long: Like the griots who preserve oral history, this person keeps organizational culture alive through storytelling, example, and teaching. They ensure the values are not just written down but lived out daily.

african_professional_leadership.name: Sankofa Organizer
african_professional_leadership.short: Builds community while honoring the ancestors
african_professional_leadership.long: Practices Sankofa - going back to fetch what was left behind. This organizer mobilizes communities with deep respect for cultural roots, traditional knowledge, and the strength that comes from collective memory.

african_social_character.name: Harambee Spirit
african_social_character.short: Pulls together when community needs them
african_social_character.long: Embodies Harambee - the spirit of pulling together. When the community calls, they answer. Not for recognition or reward, but because that's what community members do for each other.

african_social_character.name: Truth Speaker
african_social_character.short: Speaks truth with love and respect for community
african_social_character.long: Speaks truth not to tear down but to build up. They understand that honest communication is an act of love and respect for the community's wellbeing, delivered with care for relationships.

african_social_character.name: Rooted In Self
african_social_character.short: Grounded in identity, culture, and heritage
african_social_character.long: Deeply rooted in their identity and cultural heritage. They don't code-switch to please others - they bring their full authentic self while respecting the spaces they enter. Confidence from knowing who they are.

african_social_character.name: Ubuntu Heart
african_social_character.short: Feels the community's pulse, responds with care
african_social_character.long: Has deep Ubuntu consciousness - feels when someone in the community is struggling before they say a word. Responds with the care and attention that honors our interconnectedness.

african_social_connection.name: Bridge Builder
african_social_connection.long: Actively builds connections across the African diaspora - linking Kenya to Nigeria, Ghana to South Africa, Atlanta to London. They understand that our collective power comes from these connections.

african_social_connection.name: Sacred Circle Keeper
african_social_connection.short: Creates safe space for vulnerability and truth
african_social_connection.long: Creates and protects sacred spaces where people can be vulnerable, share burdens, and speak truths. Like the village circle where elders and youth gather to process life together.

african_civic_service.name: Aj√© Giver
african_civic_service.short: Gives resources, time, and energy for community
african_civic_service.long: Practices Aj√© - the principle of shared prosperity. They give their time, resources, and energy knowing that when the community prospers, everyone prospers. No one succeeds alone.

african_civic_service.name: Elder Wisdom Keeper
african_civic_service.short: Passes down knowledge to the next generation
african_civic_service.long: Follows the African tradition of elders mentoring youth. They don't gatekeep knowledge - they actively pass down wisdom, skills, and cultural knowledge to ensure the next generation stands on their shoulders.

african_academic_scholarship.name: Knowledge Griot
african_academic_scholarship.short: Preserves and creates knowledge for the people
african_academic_scholarship.long: Like the griots who preserved African knowledge through oral tradition, this scholar creates and documents knowledge that serves the community. Research that uplifts, not extracts.

african_academic_scholarship.name: Sankofa Scholar
african_academic_scholarship.long: Applies Sankofa thinking to scholarship - critically examining what was taught, reclaiming what was taken, and building knowledge that centers African perspectives and experiences.

_metadata.philosophy: Ubuntu (I am because we are), Pan-Africanism, Cultural preservation
_metadata.usage: Alternative display names/descriptions honoring African values and philosophy
_metadata.notes: Maintains same trust values and rarity - cultural framing changes

key_concepts.ubuntu: Philosophy of interconnectedness - I am because we are
key_concepts.sankofa: Go back and get it - learning from the past
